item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 19, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. TikTok says it is restoring service for U.S. users (331 points | 892 comments)
2. Why is Git Autocorrect too fast for Formula One drivers? (81 points | 35 comments)
3. Escape the walled garden and algorithm black boxes with RSS feeds (37 points | 8 comments)
4. Using your Apple device as an access card in unsupported systems (105 points | 26 comments)
5. Ancient Phoenician Shipwreck Recovered, Sank 2.6k Years Ago Off Coast of Spain (49 points | 4 comments)
6. The surprising struggle to get a Unix Epoch time from a UTC string in C or C++ (57 points | 26 comments)
7. Philosophy Eats AI (28 points | 14 comments)
8. Robotics and ROS 2 Essentials (61 points | 33 comments)
9. The Fuzzing Book (112 points | 5 comments)
10. Build a tiny CA for your homelab with a Raspberry Pi (47 points | 16 comments)
11. Build a Database in 3000 Lines with 0 Dependencies (243 points | 22 comments)
12. Forgejo: A self-hosted lightweight software forge (307 points | 221 comments)
13. Haskell: A Great Procedural Language (198 points | 151 comments)
14. GauntletAI (YC S17) will fly you out, train you to build w AI, give you 200k job ( | hide)
15. TikTok users posting cat videos do not threaten UK national security, minister (15 points | 9 comments)
16. How hard would it be to display the contents of an image file on the screen? (131 points | 49 comments)
17. Making glow-in-the-dark Strontium Aluminate (68 points | 29 comments)
18. GitHub introduces sub-issues, issue types and advanced search (275 points | 153 comments)
19. “The Traitors”, a reality TV show, offers a useful economics lesson (104 points | 92 comments)
20. A generative model for inorganic materials design (8 points | discuss)
21. IsMyXFeedFucked – Analyze How Your X Feed's Impacting You (67 points | 99 comments)
22. VS Code Pets (487 points | 125 comments)
23. About A comprehensive guide for Linux Network (Socket) programming (55 points | 8 comments)
24. How Unix spell ran in 64kb RAM (211 points | 39 comments)
25. We need to protect the protocol that runs Bluesky (147 points | 206 comments)
26. Rust: Investigating an Out of Memory Error (87 points | 27 comments)
27. Calculator Forensics (2002) (16 points | discuss)
28. 'Once-in-a-century' discovery reveals luxury of Pompeii (137 points | 91 comments)
29. Yek: Serialize your code repo (or part of it) to feed into any LLM (149 points | 63 comments)
30. Show HN: Interactive systemd – a better way to work with systemd units (497 points | 190 comments)
